title: Pre-Seminar Setup
text:
Please complete these setup steps before the seminar to ensure a smooth hands-on experience.


Quarto works in combination with a text editor to create documents. Most users use an IDE (Integrated development environment) to edit documents and improve he workflow.
We recommand two possibles setup for the seminar:





A better solution for users who want a data-science-focused IDE ready for Quarto. Recommander for beginners.



Download and install Positron from positron.posit.co. It is a free and open-source IDE.







NoteYou’re Ready!



No further installation is needed.





You can test Quarto setup by following the instructions in Section 2.







A better solution for users who prefer VS Code’s vast ecosystem.



Download Quarto: Go to the official Quarto downloads page and download the installer for your operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux) .
Run the Installer: Execute the downloaded installer and follow the on-screen instructions.
Verify Installation: Open a terminal (or Command Prompt) and run the following command to confirm Quarto is installed correctly and check for any additional dependencies like Pandoc or LaTeX :

    quarto check




Install VS Code: Download and install VS Code from code.visualstudio.com.
Install the Quarto Extension

Open VS Code.
Go to the Extensions view (Ctrl+Shift+X).
Search for quarto and install the extension published by Quarto . This extension provides syntax highlighting, preview, and code execution tools.

Install Language Support (Optional but Recommended) For enhanced support in Python, R, or Julia code cells, install the relevant extensions from the marketplace (e.g., Python, R) .




You can test Quarto setup by following the instructions in Section 2.

title: Pre-Seminar Setup
text:
Final Verification
Regardless of the IDE you chose, open it and create a new file called test.qmd. Paste the following basic content into it:



Listing 1: Código fonte de uma pagina Quarto (.qmd) para testar a instalação


---
title: "My First Quarto Article"
author:
  - name: "João Silva"
    affiliation: "Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa"
    email: jozinho@gmail.com
format: html
lang: pt
date: "October 23, 2025"
---

# Introduction

This is a simple Quarto article. Quarto allows you to mix text, code, and output in a single document.



To verify everything works:

In Positron: Use the same Quarto: Preview command or click the preview button in the editor toolbar .
In VS Code: Use the Quarto: Preview command (Ctrl+Shift+K) .

If a preview window opens showing a formatted document similar to this preview, your installation is successful.

title: About the Seminar
text:
This 2-hour intensive seminar is designed for Master’s students in Computer Science and Multimedia who are preparing to write their theses. It is also relevant to everyone who is doing research and publish their results in an open and transparent approach. We focus on practical, immediately applicable skills.


By the end of this seminar, you will be able to:


Create and render basic Quarto documents
Build a multi-page website like this one
Integrate computational content and multimedia
Implement a reproducible workflow for your thesis / research





Final year Master’s students looking to enhance their technical publishing skills and create compelling, interactive thesis documents.

title: Introduction to Quarto
text:
In the evolving landscape of academic publishing, the demand for reproducible research and dynamic content has never been greater. Traditional publishing workflows often create silos between data analysis, manuscript preparation, and final publication. Quarto emerges as a unified solution that bridges these gaps, offering researchers a robust framework for creating documents that are both computationally reproducible and professionally formatted.




Date: October 23, 2025
Time: 18:30 - 20:30
Location: Edifício F
Room: Auditório C




Cédric Grueau
Department of Computer Science and Engineering - ISEL









NoneWhy Quarto for Your Thesis/Research?




Reproducibility: Integrate code, results, and narrative seamlessly
Multi-Format Output: Create PDF, HTML, Word, and presentations from one source
Dynamic Content: Embed interactive visualizations and computational elements








Quarto document fundamentals
Creating interactive websites
Advanced multimedia integration
Thesis workflow optimization






Language Agnostic: Python, R, Julia, Observable
Professional Output: LaTeX-quality PDFs
Collaboration Ready: Version control friendly
